did.unittitle: Students of agriculture, Mysore Director of Agriculture

daogrp.xlink:title: Students of agriculture, Mysore Director of Agriculture

daodesc.p: Students of agriculture, Mysore Director of Agriculture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From Students of Agriculture to Leslie Coleman, Director of Agriculture in Mysore, dated 17th April, 1915. The letter is printed on a silk cloth. Students express their gratitude to Coleman for his guidance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From Wilhelm Ruhland, Botanist, to Leslie Coleman, dated 3rd July, 1951. Concerning shipment of fava beans that Coleman had requested.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From K. Venkatagiri Rau to Leslie Coleman, dated 10th December, 1951. Rau reports on his duties as an Agricultural Inspector at Tiptur.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a letter from K. H. Srinivasan to Leslie Coleman, dated 25th February, 1952. Discussing whereabouts of mutual acquaintances from Mysore Agricultural Department.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From H. V. Krishnayya to Leslie Coleman, dated 3rd March, 1952. Pleasantries and reminiscences of time spent together in India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from S H Bennur to Leslie Coleman, dated 18th March, 1952. Pleasantries and update on the status of Mysore sugar company at Mandya, Mysore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From M. B. Krishna Rao to Leslie Coleman, dated 4th April, 1952. Pleasantries and reminiscences about the time spent together in India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from H. V. Krishnayya to Leslie Coleman, dated 7th April, 1952. Pleasantries and reports on whereabouts of mutual acquaintances like M Visvesvaraya and Sakamma.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From S H Bennur to Leslie Coleman, dated 25th April, 1952. Pleasantries and references to Mysore Sugar Factory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From H. V. Krishnayya to Leslie Coleman, dated 20th May, 1952. Pleasantries and reports on the whereabouts of mutual acquaintances including P. M. N. Naidu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From H. V. Krishnayya to Leslie Coleman, dated 8th October, 1952. Pleasantries and discussion on P. M. N. Naidu's research into cattle and poultry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From H. V. Krishnayya to Leslie Coleman, dated 10th November, 1952. Pleasantries plus a reference to Coleman's articles about Indian agriculture on 'Canadian Forum'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From C. J. H. Penning, Ex General Manager of Mysore Sugar Company to Leslie Coleman, dated 3rd January, 1953. Refers to his travels to several sugar plantations across the colonies. Also includes references to Col W. L.Crawford, V. P. Madhav Rao and Arcot Ramaswamy Mudaliar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From H. V. Krishnayya to Leslie Coleman, dated 29th January, 1953. Discusses Coleman's articles about Indian agriculture on 'Canadian Forum'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From D. I. Bonarjee to Leslie Coleman, dated 10th February, 1953. Concerning Payment Forms.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: To Leslie Coleman, dated 15th February, 1953. From a practising doctor who was the Director of Public Health in Mandya. Including references to an anti-malaria programme that is being carried out in Mysore state.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pleasantries and whereabouts of mutual acquaintances. Includes a reference to coffee berry borer treatment with 'agrocide'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses Coleman's article on village life in India. Includes references to issues such as temple-entry, conversion and mistreatment of lower caste groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning Coleman's planned visit to India to advise on 'Coffee matters'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From K Hanumanthaiya, Chief Minister, Mysore state, to Leslie Coleman dated 9th July, 1954. Concerning Coleman's visit to the state and his recommendations regarding the Agricultural Department in Mysore State.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pleasantries and reports on the whereabouts of B Ganapath Rao's family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pleasantries and reports on events in Mysore state.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses Coleman's visit to Mysore State. Includes Coleman's recommendations regarding the Agricultural Department in Mysore State.

did.unittitle: Sub-Series 2: Letters from Leslie Coleman - Visit to India

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses his journey from Gander to London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses his journey to Karachi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses his journey to Bombay.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses his welcome and stay at Bangalore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning his stay in Mysore State.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events and anecdotes about his stay in Mysore state.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Anecdotes about his stay as 'State Guest'. Mentions meeting with the Chief Minister and Robert Lake, Chairman of the Mysore Planters Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events and anecdotes about his stay in Mysore state. Mentions Vice President Nixon's visit to India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Anecdotes about his stay in Mysore state.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events and anecdotes about his stay in Mysore state. Mentions a meeting with Chairman of Mysore Sugar Company and the Bangalore Literary Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events and anecdotes about his stay in Mysore state. Mentions a meeting with Ralph Morris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events and anecdotes about his stay in Bangalore, including a shopping trip to Commercial Street in Bangalore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events and anecdotes about his stay in Mysore state. Mentions inauguration of a new glass house at Lal Bagh in Bangalore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his tour of villages in the Mysore state in India to evaluate agricultural practices and departments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing sights and events during his tour of villages in the Mysore state in India to evaluate agricultural practices and departments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his tour of Marathahalli in the Mysore state in India to evaluate agricultural practices and departments. Refers to an anti-malaria drive in Mysore state.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his stay at Coffee Research Station, Balehonnur in the Mysore state in India to evaluate agricultural practices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his stay at Coffee Research Station, Balehonnur in the Mysore state in India to evaluate agricultural practices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his stay at Coffee Research Station, Balehonnur in the Mysore state in India to evaluate agricultural practices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his stay at Honnametti with the Morris' in the Mysore state in India to evaluate agricultural practices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his stay at Mysore. Includes references to Mrs Irvine and Mrs McGann, attached as companions to Dowager Maharani of Mysore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his stay at Mandya. Mentions a commemoration ceremony for Coleman held at Mysore Sugar Company, also refers to the Krishnarajasagara dam.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A summary of events during his stay in Mysore state. Attached is a typewritten copy of the letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions W W Mayne, former coffee scientific officer at United Planters Association of South India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions W W Mayne, Hebbal farm and Agricultural College. Attached is a typewritten version of the letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From Leslie Coleman to Ann Coleman, dated 12th January, 1954. Detailing events during his stay in the Mysore state in India. Mentions Robert J. Flaherty, Van Ingen taxidermists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his stay in Mysore state. Mentions the Srinivasans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing events during his stay in Mysore state. Mentions the M N Krishna Rao, Botanical Society of Central College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing visit to Bellary during his tour of the Mysore state

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions Coffee Research Station, Balehonnur. Details the itinerary of the rest of Coleman's stay in Mysore state.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes itinerary for the last half of Coleman's stay in Mysore state. Mentions difficulties of getting any business done in India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions coffee planters of Coorg and Canadian Prime Minister Louis St. Laurent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailing his visit to Spun Silk Mills at Channapatna. Mentions the Maharaja of Mysore state.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions last leg of Coleman's tour in Bangalore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Observations about villages that Coleman had visited during his tour of Mysore state.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions Principal of Institute of Technology, Kharagpur and Rama Reddy, a friend of Coleman's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions a report on agricultural practices that Coleman was commissioned to write by the government.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Details his tour of Hoskote and Kolar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions a report on agricultural practices that Coleman was writing for the government. Also includes mention of 17 framed addresses given to Coleman in India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding journey back to Canada. Mentions Morris' and Davisons of Oakville.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions A R Gopala Ayengar, K Hanumanthaiya, Chief Minister, Mysore state and R Nagan Gowda, Minister of Agriculture. Includes references to M J Narasimhan, and H V Krishnayya.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding plans for London during journey back to Canada

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A commemorative address printed on silk given to Coleman at the Bangalore District Sericulture Conference in Channapatna. Includes a song about silk and sericulture in Kannada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Titled 'Tai Nadu' (Motherland). Welcomes Coleman back to Mysore state and details his achievements during his service in India.

did.unittitle: Taluk Agricultural and Experimental Union, Thirthahalli

daogrp.xlink:title: Taluk Agricultural and Experimental Union, Thirthahalli

daodesc.p: Taluk Agricultural and Experimental Union, Thirthahalli

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions Coleman's role in protecting areca crop from the ravages of 'Koleroga' disease using Bordeaux mixture.

did.unittitle: Chikmagalur District Agricultural and Experimental Union

daogrp.xlink:title: Chikmagalur District Agricultural and Experimental Union

daodesc.p: Chikmagalur District Agricultural and Experimental Union

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions Coleman's contributions in setting up Coffee Research Station at Balehonnur, a cattle breeding station at Ajjampur, an Agricultural and Experimental Union and an Agricultural School in Chikamagalur

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions Coleman's role in setting up the Mysore Sugar Company at Mandya in 1933, and the groundwork he laid for a molasses distillery which was set up in 1935. Includes details about production rates at the factory.

did.unittitle: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Yelahanka

daogrp.xlink:title: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Yelahanka

daodesc.p: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Yelahanka

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions Coleman's role in making an improved plough, and breeding of ragi and sugarcane varieties to improve yield. Includes references to Mysore Agricultural Journal and Coleman's article titled ' After twenty years' and refers to the Agricultural and Experimental Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions government supported use of 'jarsa' breed of ragi during drought years. Includes issues regarding a well at the local school.

did.unittitle: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Goridibinur

daogrp.xlink:title: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Goridibinur

daodesc.p: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Goridibinur

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions name of some of the farmers of Goribidinur taluk who worked with Coleman. Includes references to sugarcane and tobacco, Acharya high school, and the requirement of an artificial insemination centre and poultry demonstration unit in the district.

did.unittitle: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Channapatna Taluk

daogrp.xlink:title: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Channapatna Taluk

daodesc.p: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Channapatna Taluk

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions activities of the Channapatna Agricultural and Experimental Union, including use of a Japanese system of paddy cultivation

did.unittitle: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union Ryots of Ramanagaram Taluk

daogrp.xlink:title: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union Ryots of Ramanagaram Taluk

daodesc.p: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union Ryots of Ramanagaram Taluk

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes references to crop breeds, Ragi H22 and Sugarcane H M 320. Also includes a list of requirements provided by farmers of Ramanagaram Agricultural and Experimental Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions activities of the Taluk Agricultural and Experimental Union, Magadi.

did.unittitle: Kolar District Agricultural and Experimental Union

daogrp.xlink:title: Kolar District Agricultural and Experimental Union

daodesc.p: Kolar District Agricultural and Experimental Union

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions mixed farming methods in dry tracts in the arid Kolar district. Includes reference to Mokshagundam Visweswaraiah.

did.unittitle: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Bangarpet Taluk

daogrp.xlink:title: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Bangarpet Taluk

daodesc.p: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Bangarpet Taluk

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions H22 Ragi breed, and requirement for a ragi variant to be grown through July to October, which is the sparse rainfall season in Kolar district.

did.unittitle: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Chintamani Taluk

daogrp.xlink:title: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Chintamani Taluk

daodesc.p: Mysore Agricultural and Experimental Union, Chintamani Taluk

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions H 22 Ragi breed, 'Koleroga' and measures against grasshopper attack implemented by Coleman. Also lists requirements of the Agricultural and Experimental Union of Chintamani Taluk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions cattle veterinary centre in Malur town. Includes names of dignitaries present at the event and unveiling of the donor's statue at the veterinary centre.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions Coleman's contribution in setting up of Coffee Research Station at Balehonnur and Visvesvaraya canal in Mandya.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions Coleman's contribution in setting up a Veterinary Department in the taluk.
